title: Emergency Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I didn't hear anything until 2 months after I applied. Had a single panel interview, which I felt went well. Sent a follow-up email, which was never responded to. It's now been 3&1/2 months and I have heard nothing. It still says "under consideration" in the online portal, so either the process is incredibly slow and they don't bother to keep candidates informed, or they don't update candidates whatsoever if/when they hire another candidate. Either way, it's unacceptable to completely ghost a candidate and their process desperately needs to be adjusted.

In the email setting up the interview, it was explicitly stated that it would be held via Zoom but just like a phone interview with no cameras. When I logged on, all of the interviewees had their cameras on, so just something to be prepared for.

title: Coordinator of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Scranton, PA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
This interview was for the Penn State Scranton campus. 

The first interview was a zoom interview with a panel of six. It would have lasted 30 mins, but I interviewed them for 15 mins as I wanted to make sure it was a good fit. In this interview, they were unable to state if the position would allow for work-life balance. Simply saying the work was rewarding. 

I then got a phone call from HR from the main campus (state college) inviting me to a final interview (a campus visit) and asking about salary expectations. I requested their range as regional campuses tend to be lower salaries; their range was 35-50K depending on education and experience. With the qualifications and education I have, I asked for 48-50. 

Before the campus visit, I got an itinerary with some significant errors, including the wrong date. I got to campus and was rushed through many meetings. The campus tour was disorganized. During the campus visit, they expressed the hours would be exhaustive. 8:30-5:30 ish with some nights; this clarified why they answered my work-life balance question the way they did.

I will say a good thing was the campus visit travel was reimbursed as well as lunch; this is a standard higher education practice that does not include those who may be low SES; from a Diversity Equity and Inclusion stance, this is an issue. 

Based on the projected start date, I was supposed to hear if I got an offer within a week. I was ghosted for two weeks instead of getting any email, even one that said we are still working on the process. I had sent two emails the Monday after I was to hear, and then a week and a half later, at that point, I figured I didn't get the job; I just wanted my reimbursement check, which I had not gotten an update on. I got a copy and pasted email with errors (they left another staff member's signature on it) saying I did not get the job; no other text was included. I followed up about reimbursement said I would get it in a couple of days that the staff member who was to process wasn't in. I did get it three days later. 

Overall I was not impressed with the process. The communication was horrible. The interview lasted 45 mins, and the campus visit lasted three hours. I am writing this review because I think ghosting a candidate after a campus visit is reflective of a toxic culture. Also important to note for prospective candidates at Penn State Scranton the campus itself is not accessible to those who have mobility issues. You would have to drive all of the buildings.
Interview Questions: They were all generic. They seemed to get their questions from the first three links on a google search.

title: Intern Interview

Interview Descriptions: easy, basic questions. Come prepared. Strengths and weaknesses. Say a time when you helped someone else. Say a time when you were a leader. Ask questions at the end. Polite and casual
Interview Questions: What is a time when you showed leadership

title: Coordinator of Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview initially, then an on-campus interview which lasted pretty much the whole work day. This involved separate interviews with the hiring manager, campus partners, students,  the head of the division and an open presentation on the practical use of  Student Development  Theory.
Interview Questions: They asked a variety of questions on how to support different demographics of students. This campus had a large international and commuter populations so they asked specifically for those groups.

title: Strategic Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Had a face to face interview, asked about general knowledge and experience. Usual interview question, strengths and weaknesses, skills you possess, interviewed for Prevention Research Center in the BBH building
Interview Questions: What do you think you can most contribute to this organization

title: IRB Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Really focused on interactions with researchers and building trust with them. Three rounds of interview, one with HR, second with two direct overhead managers, and a final with those two managers and two senior positions.
Interview Questions: Describe a complicated experience with a researcher who was unhappy with you.

title: R&D Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and email offer less than 24 hours later. Asked general questions about interests, passions, and technical experience. Interviewed with two people. Very casual and got along well with bosses.
Interview Questions: Why are you studying aerospace?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Asking previous research experience for contributing their lab project at Penn State. It was in the zoom meeting and I talked to all group members. I did my presentation, then they asked different task about my research.
Interview Questions: Can you tell how do you make a research plan for a project?

title: Facility Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and laid back. The interviewers were very down to earth. More of a conversation than just questions and answers. After the questions were done they explained the job description. Overall, it was a good interview experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: This position does not require a formal interview. They mostly want to see how you've done in courses and if you had an A you are normally good. Sometimes you have to know a professor and ask to TA with them next semester.
Interview Questions: Did you get an A in this class?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Phone call then on site. Standard round Robin questions where the asker doesn't care about the question they ask. Process takes forever, you never hear back. No agility or out of the box conversations.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when...

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Respectful, collegial, and as painless as an academic search can be. Phone interview request was two weeks after application deadline, invitation to visit campus was several weeks after that. They ended up cancelling the search after my campus visit due to a hiring freeze but could not have been nicer or more professional
Interview Questions: What is a graduate level course not currently offered in our college that you would like to teach

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Had an online video interview where there were multiple people in the room but only one person was asking questions. Following this, there are written interviews and another formal interview in person
Interview Questions: Simple questions, what data programs have ypu used

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a two stage process for hiring new people. The process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making the hire
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. They ask a lot of questions and look for specific examples of how you handle complex assignments.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was really smooth. the advisor aske me questions related to my PhD project and told me more about the project that he is working on it. So be prepare to talk about your PhD thesis
Interview Questions: tell me about your background?

title: Student Food Serci Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: You apply online on a website and then have to go in person to fill some paperwork and take a quiz. It was very easy and anyone student could get hired immediately.
Interview Questions: They didnt ask anything

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked about research experience and future research direction. Most of the questions were research based. Asked about previous publications and research presentations. They checked about how I will be fitting into the new research and asked whether I will have any grant writing experience.
Interview Questions: 1. Why you are interested in this lab?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: For my current job, it wen very quickly. I met with a committee then talked to a few people individually and was hired with a phone call the next week. For another job I interviewed for, I met with my supervisor, potential coworkers, then the super's supervisor. Didn't get that job.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a challenging interview for a news story?

title: Student Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Individual Phone Screen, Virtual Interview with a committee of four, Networking conversations with committee of four, Presentation on a given prompt related to position with students present as well as interview committee members..
Interview Questions: What is one strength that you believe will help you in fulfilling this position?

title: STEM Education Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions:
This review applies to this position and the center that hosts it, which is a division from the College of Education called CSATS. This does not reflect my opinion of Penn State University as a whole. 

I applied for this position in 2018 and 2019. The first time I applied for this my application was stalled for a long time after the closing date. I emailed a couple of people within CSATS to inquire about my application and I never heard back from them. Having browsed their website I knew the former STEM Education Outreach Specialist was a woman. I learned I did not get this position later, not from HR, not from CSATS but from an ONLINE DATING APP!! At the time I was online dating and noticed a profile from a man that listed he was a STEM Education Outreach Specialist. I checked the website and there it was. 

In 2019 I was still interested in that job because it actually sounds very interesting and I thought I would be a perfect fit. I applied for this position again. Weeks later they emailed me notifying me that they "they will not be filling the job at this time". I do not understand why they would open a position if they do not intend to hire anybody. 

I feel I wasted my time and CSATS does not seem well organized to me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (Hershey, PA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, things were progressing smoothly and without much difficulty. It was crucial to grasp the program's preferred candidate qualities, ensuring alignment. Fortunately, the job description adequately supplied the necessary details, aiding in understanding the position's requirements and expectations.
Interview Questions: What is the analytical software you mostly use?

title: Culinary Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Minimum you get trained so they just wanna see what you know, you get asked about the foods you like and like to prepare. Also of course to tell them about yourself and so on
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and who you are

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Malvern, PA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The professor shortlist the student based on the interests mentioned in the resume. Asks questions about the familiarity with the technology and sends it to the chancellor for review. Based on funding, the students are assigned the professor to work under.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience with Blockchain? If no, how committed and interested are you to learn?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Reading, PA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. It was easy. No need to worry. Just ask for a job and they will give it to you. I am now only doing this for a word count.
Interview Questions: There was no interview process. It was easy. No need to worry. Just ask for a job and they will give it to you. I am now only doing this for a word count.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with a panel of individuals from different departments who all asked scripted questions. Asked about background and situation questions. A week later asked to come to campus for a interview with the same people. Had to make a presentation on how to make their website better. Kind of happy I wasn’t offered the job. I pointed out a mobile app they had and no one knew they had an app. Very disorganized and unprofessional at times. Was also asked for references which they never contacted. Put in a lot of work for this interview and traveled over five hours for and spent a lot of money on travel, meals and a hotel and never heard from them.
Interview Questions: How would you improve the website

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: A video conference happened with my mentor and other professors. They asked for my expertise related to the project. My GIS skills, programming skills, and communication skill. How can I contribute to the project?
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to the project with your skill and experiences?

title: Games Management/Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: very laid back, casual, felt like you were just having a conversation. Asked about past experiences whether it was playing or coaching. Recruiting and how I went about looking/talking to prospects
Interview Questions: What do you look for when recruiting?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Basic Behavioral questions to see how you deal with certain situations , typical ones found on google and not hard to answer. Like how do you like working in teams, greatest weaknesses and strengths
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the company website and met with the supervisor couple of weeks later.  I did a presentation on what I have done previously and they explained what is expected of me.
Interview Questions: What do you think about the locations of the campus.

title: International Student Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with two other people and myself. It was conducted by two managers from of Global programs. It was more like a conversation, very casual and they took notes.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your orientation partner was not there and you had to lead a group of 30 students yourself?

title: R&D Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email and then submitted an application online. Spoke with two people on the phone for about 45mins and got offered the job the next day. Interview was very laid back and just talked about UAS related topics.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in aerospace engineering?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: very easy phone interview. Very similar to role required by job. Just read the script well in advance and sound enthusiastic on call. Job can be boring at times. For the interview be prepared to ask 3 times
Interview Questions: mock call - script given

title: Career Placement Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Bethlehem, PA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then got a call from the administrative assistant from the department that they would like to schedule an online interview. I had a online interview  with the department including the 2 Directors and 1 administrative assistant.
Interview Questions: They asked me typical behavioral questions, such as "describe a situation when you solved a problem, or tell me about a time when you were involved in a team project and what was the outcome."

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I met my Professor in person and spoke to him about being an RA. I later emailed my resume and a cover letter. I was asked some questions on the nature of work I previously did during my internships. I was briefed about the work I had to do if selected as an RA.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become an RA?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: it interview is easy but they ask lots of valuable questions that every orientation leader should pay attention on and always think about. it is a great interview experience. I learn alot from this interview.
Interview Questions: What is diversity mean to you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was slow and I did not get a response quickly.  The interview itself was quick and easy.  It was not anything to be too nervous for.  The onboarding sessions are a bit cumbersome.
Interview Questions: What is your goal for this job?

title: Teaching Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and after about a month, the school contacted me via email and we did a Skype interview. Three people in the search committee took turns to ask questions, which were expected during the preparation process.
Interview Questions: How would you teach refugee students?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was about a 20 minute process, and I met with who would be my supvisor and 4 other peers. They have your resume printed out in front of them, and highlighted sections of it. They have prewritten questions that they take turns asking.
Interview Questions: How do you handle interruptions?

title: Administrative Support Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (Harrisburg, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Entirely too long. Applied, completed phone interview successfully, completed on-campus interview with several panels and several individuals , all references called...no offer. 6 months total time. Applied in October and heard back that I did not get the job in March - Felt this process was long and exhausting and probably too intensive for an admin position
Interview Questions: Have you ever taken a stand for something you believe in?

title: IT Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. Mainly asked about past experience in computer software/technical repairs. They were not too hard such as connecting WiFi, connecting to a VPN, experience with common laptop problems such as keyboard and screen malfunctioning, virus issues and browser issues.
Interview Questions: Favorite technology

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: easy, not too hard. Very relaxed environment. Great location.  In person and online were both seamless and easy to navigate. I would go through this process again if necessary.
Interview Questions: Explain your current position and how it relates to this one?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not very intense. But it will depend on the advisor. PennState is not very strict at faculty doing a lot of research. They focus on teaching because the large amount of undergraduate.
Interview Questions: What do you think that you can contribute to Pennstate

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (New Kensington, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Poorly executed at the New Kensington campus. A series of 10 current employees in a room, each asking an irrelevant question, with obvious hostility between a couple of them. Leadership used crass language. As if it were a high school culture.
Interview Questions: What would you do for me if you worked here?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straight forward. Submitted application through the portal. Received a call to set up an interview maybe two weeks later.  It was just me and the interview committee. For the first part they read questions off of a sheet of paper. After that, they did ask some basic technical questions.
Interview Questions: How would you tell someone to make a peanut butter sandwich?

title: R&D Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions:
A month after applying, I got an call to make a phone call appointment with the hiring manager. The phone interview was more about getting to know you and your future career. 2+ weeks later, I got a call for an on-site interview that lasting no more than 3 hours. I got to meet the hiring manager and his team in person and discuss about the position more. They asked basic question about my previous engineering background 
and asked me to do a simple problem solving for the given situation they proposed. The team is nice and brilliant. Offer was made a month after the on-site interview because the HR was busy.
Interview Questions: Questions about past experience.

title: Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. Friendly staff. As a University, the interview was done by committee, however, I do not know if the hiring decision was a group decision or solely discretion of supervising manager of the position.
Interview Questions: Typical questions pertaining to position. No surprises.

title: Student IT Help Desk Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (New Kensington, PA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: As a student consultant the interview is very basic, as long as you are willing to learn you are a good candidate. This position is all about growing your soft skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you... All questions related to this.

title: Data Base Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (Abington, PA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
It was not hard
I got interviewed by my professor to get my internship 
We went through SQL, Oracle, and APEX. The interview was less than an hour and it was an only one interview
Interview Questions:
What are your hours? 
When can you work?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: day long interview with multiple group interviews. it was nice you were exposed to many different employees and departments, however long and a lot to take in for an interview process.  they were very welcoming and made the interview process comfortable.
Interview Questions: ask about previous experience & resume material

title: Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Plain and simple. Dont be rude and be honest. Everything was straight forward - why do you want to work here? - where did you hear about us? - do you enjoy a job working with alumni and selling your soul for money?
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here? - where did you hear about us? - do you enjoy a job working with alumni and selling your soul for money?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Group of staff interviewed me and asked a number of questions and also there was a one-on-one meeting with the Head Librarian. All under an hour. It was pretty painless as far as interviews go.
Interview Questions: Why Penn State Great Valley?

title: Graduate Fellow for University General Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was the typical law firm interview experience. There were 6-20 minute interviews through the whole day, with a lunch sandwiched between. They asked very straight-forward questions (like "Why do you want to work at Penn State"; "Why do you want to work for this office").
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our general counsel's office?

title: Media Lab Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Not difficult, you need to have a relationship to receive the position.  The process of getting through HR can take a while but overall it is not that big of a hassle.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: For most Penn State student jobs you apply online pretty quickly. You'll definitely have to speak with and review your resume with who posted the job. You may also have to interview with other team members and demonstrate some competencies to them. Good GPA helps a lot.
Interview Questions: Fizz/Buzz

title: Study Abroad Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial 30-minute phone screening with search committee, then 4-hour in-person interview that included 4 separate components, including giving a presentation on your choice of 3 topics. Then absolutely no answer to follow-up emails, travel reimbursement, not even the common curtesy of a no-hire email after investing all that time in the process.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when you had to work with many departments or groups of people in order to complete a project.

title: Cyber Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: 5 person interview committee. 1 manager, 1 expert, 3 customers. 2 hour interview. There was an unhappy customer scenario. Favorite project scenario. Standard fare getting to know you questions thirty words words
Interview Questions: Owasp top 10, csa, firewalls

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Submitted the application around in late January. Got the first round interview in February with two faculty members. Then, the final interview was conducted with groups of standing faculties.
Interview Questions: What do you expect to achieve at PSU?

title: Fleet Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: 4 hour interview with 16 people. Two sessions being asked questions by all of the individuals involved. Also was given a tour of the facility which took 45 minutes and was not really necessary. Penn State usually hires from within so after all the preparation, the job was probably already taken.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with diversity at your last place of employment?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Malvern, PA)
Interview Descriptions: You are contacted by a recruiter first. The first round of interviews were with three current employees who are all in the department. They round table rapid fired interviews questions for about 50 minutes. Some questions were a bit odd, but a majority had to do with the interview. No real chance to get to know the potential employee and their personality with how quick the questions came, and no real chance given to have a conversation... just question and answer.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the campuses you will be working at?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, and your were asked to first introduce your self, then you need to go through and describe the research project in your cv. In the end you can ask the interviewer any question you want to ask. The whole process is less than 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: describe the research project in your cv.

title: Service Delivery Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included time with members of the team that would be managed, as well as time with the director that the position would be reporting to. Questions pertained to leadership style, team building, relationship building, and knowledge of work.
Interview Questions: If someone is not performing as expected, or as they normally do, what is your approach to addressing this observation?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions, They look for an attitude to learn. They do have the whole group you will be working with, sit in the interview. Attitude-based questions. Not technical. Just relax and Enjoy
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The staff and students were extremely nice. They all seemed genuinely excited to meet me and the interview process was super relaxed. I had the opportunity tour the campus and it was an overall pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Why did you specifically choose Penn State

title: Campus Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line.  Called to set up a skype interview.  Interviewed by a panel of 6 consisting of peers, supervisor, and subject matter professor.  Months later automatic email sent informing me the position had been cancelled.
Interview Questions: What are the trends in campus planning

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application and waited to hear back. The coordinator emails you back, detailing whether or not you received an offer. They also let you know whether you are categorized as a Coach or a Grader
Interview Questions: What classes have you taken in IST and received a grade of A- or above?

title: Power Plant Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of meeting with the Steam Plant Operations Supervisor and the Superintendent of Steam Services. They ask about your background in operating power plants and what skills you have. They will also ask generic HR type questions such as "what would you do if you had a disagreement with a supervisor". After the interview, if they like what they see, management will arrange for you to take a written test. If you pass that, you'll be called in for a "hands-on" test which really just serves as a formality and encompasses ensuring you can handle being in a confined space (such as a boiler or DA tank). After that, the university will run a background check to ensure you're not a child molester and you'll be starting a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: What would you do if boiler level indication showed an empty boiler?

title: Administrative Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Malvern, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received a phone call to schedule a phone screening within a week or so. The phone interview lasted approximately 30 minutes and I spoke with 3 people. The questions were mostly behavioral, asking how I would react or perform in certain situations; nothing unexpected. Approximately a week or so after that I received an email to schedule an in-person interview at the Great Valley campus. This interview was with a panel of four people, and after this I met with the Chancellor one-on-one. The panel of four consisted of:  the administrative coordinator, one professor, and two other administrative support assistants. The questions were fairly similar to the ones I was asked on the phone, including asking about previous experience, and I was also asked why I thought they should hire me. The following meeting with the Chancellor was pretty much the same, and focused on the same questions and how my previous experience helped me prepare for this kind of position. 

This was easily one of the best interview experiences I have had. The people were all incredibly friendly and welcoming, and I really enjoyed speaking with them. They made me feel comfortable and at ease. I was impressed with the employee-focused atmosphere they promoted. They were very focused on employee happiness and making sure everyone in the offices worked together well, were happy, and were a team. I asked them how they would measure success in this position, and I received this answer: "If you go home at the end of the day and you're happy, then you're successful." This caught me off guard, in a good way. There are not enough employers that not only focus on doing good work but making it a great environment for their employees as well. I was disappointed to not receive an offer, but am very grateful I had the chance to interview at this Penn State campus. From what I experienced just from an interview, I can imagine this is a fantastic place to work.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you for this position?

title: Commons Desk Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal. It most mostly just paperwork and asking what my class schedule was for the semester and other obligations when I would be busy and would be unable to work. They then let me know what shifts were open and what I would be able to work.
Interview Questions: What do you find is the best way to boost team morale?

title: DDAR Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Submit a resume, and about a 3 page essay. Then you can get selected for the first interview with the HR team and if you make it through that you will be assigned a college unit, or units, to interview with. Is a very long process but I was lucky enough to be selected and its been great. summer in state college is so worth it and you learn so much about the school. do your best on every aspect because it is surprisingly competitive
Interview Questions: A time you had to deal with adversity and how you over came it

title: Purchasing Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview with a panel.  25  minute interview and then I was given a whopping 5 minutes to ask questions. It was the worst interviewing process for a first interview that I have been through. Off of this interview they were bringing in candidates to interview onsite. There is no way they could have gotten to know me in 30 minutes. This is my alma mater and after this experience I would not want to work for them.
Interview Questions: What do you know about how our department operates?

title: Human Research Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: submitted formal application online, was contacted for phone interview, was subsequently offered position, and then accepted position. Was not a long, drawn out process as they needed someone very quickly and I was qualified.
Interview Questions: asked about research experience

title: Fundraising Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very stiff, not welcoming. Got the impression they knew everything and weren't open to new ideas. Seemed very transactional, not transformational. Based too much on analytics and not on people skills.
Interview Questions: How many in-person visits should you be able to get done each month?

title: Mail Processing Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Wyomissing, PA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went in and didn't feel nervous.  I applied for a housekeeping job.  Was interviewed by two nice young guys.  They asked really good questions about me. Was eventually selected for the mail clerk job based on my interview answers.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (Abington, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got in contact with a professor who referred me to the recruiter/supervisor. The interview was fairly straightforward. I was told on the spot that I got the job and what my duties would be as a TA.
Interview Questions: Why are you interesting for this position?

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Middletown, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick response by both phone and email; confirmed all details in follow up email and included directions for campus and building.  Provided clear information on type of interview, who would be present, and estimated length; also advised on items to bring.
Interview Questions: Scenario question related to how to resolve a potential conflict between several different parties whose work role I would be responsible for.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Professors that students are interested in are in charge of interview process.  A few phone interviews from the professors followed by an on site interview organized by the department.
Interview Questions: What is your research background.

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was very intense. We were to meet with more than 5 faculty members and talk to them. They can range from mild to aggressive. Be prepared about your previous research and also study up on the professors and their area of expertise. They will ask you about how much you know about them
Interview Questions: Mostly about research interests, and what you foresee working on in the program

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Penn State (Penn State University, PA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I found out, the earlier you bid on a position the better.   Sign up for the alerts to get notified immediately of new openings.  This job I applied for the same day it posted, and about six weeks later I was called to set up a phone screen/interview.   Just a few people taking turns asking standard interview questions, no feedback.   Plenty of opportunity to ask questions.   About a month later, I received a call to schedule an in-person interview.   I was sent a day-long schedule that included meetings with several departments and leaders with a  break for lunch, & gave a 30-minute presentation,   I didn't hear anything for about another six weeks, then I was called with a salary offer.  HR sets salaries so there isn't much room to negotiate.   PSU has a very organized onboarding process.  The people in human resources were very communicative and made sure things moved quickly after my offer so that I could start the following month.
Interview Questions: "How do you handle disagreements with coworkers?"

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Middletown Center, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I can't remember. But I have a 30 word minimum so I'll just make something up. We laughed and talked and rode the swings together and then we debated whether unicorns are real or not. I think they are.
Interview Questions: Another 30 words. It was too long ago for me to remember. He asked me if I had any pets and I said, as a matter of fact, I do. I showed him pictures of my kitties because my kitties are very important to me and that's how I roll.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Penn State (Erie, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved a face to face discussion with the professor I would be conducting research under. The professor wanted to know my career aspirations to ensure they aligned with the values needed to be a successful researcher.
Interview Questions: What are your career aspirations?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone screen followed by a one day set of meetings. Meetings were with numerous individuals, a committee or two, a presentation, and then an exit interview with the decision makes.
Interview Questions: They asked if anything had happened to make me more sympathetic to the needs of others.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with supervisor and then with PhD student. Emailed a bunch of professors to see if they were looking for any help with their research.  Got back promptly and scheduled an in person interview and then a panel interview.
Interview Questions: Asked about my grades, my interest in the project, and what I was hoping to get out of it. Then my availability and transportation.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Harrisburg, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Standard job talk, search committee were there, very few audiences
lunch interview with a Professor
interview with the search committee, they prepared a list of questions to ask me in turn
meet the dean
meet the chancellor
Interview Questions:
all standard
looks like the search committee spent time on preparing the questions

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: easy process great interview easy to talk to.One you have an interview you are set.The interview did not require dressing up it was casual office ware the next time you receive your uniform
Interview Questions: how to react in stressfull situaction

title: SEALab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got simple coding questions and a geometry worksheet. Got some behavioral questions and questions about things like JVM and differences between heavyweight and lightweight in swing. Had to go through like 5 different people
Interview Questions: How does the JVM work?

title: Opp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: A multiple person interview. I interviewed in front of 4 people getting asked a question from each person. It was informal and the questions were not hard behavioral.  At least 2 of the people in the room were who you could be working for.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you worked in a team and were challenged

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: A professor sent a department-wide email asking for graduate students to volunteer to be TAs.  I replied with a list of the courses that I was hoping to TA... No response, for two months.  I decided to speak directly with the professors of the courses that I wanted to TA, and soon found a good match.  No further interview was necessary, the professor took care of assigning me to be his TA, and the checks started rolling in as soon as the class started.
Interview Questions: Will you please TA one of the chemical engineering courses next semester?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from the hiring manager to set up an interview. Went to his office for an interview. Manager was very kind and worked with two other managers. Only got interviewed by the one. Customer service skills are very important as well.
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Penn State (Middletown, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There's no need to stress because interview process was easy. They do not require that much from you. It's an on-campus job, so it is basically they hire on a need basis.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The application required the submission of a portfolio, a cv, a letter of intent, and the list of 3 references to be contacted. I was a former student and it seems they do not like hiring their former students, at least within the same department.
Interview Questions: Did not make the short list

title: Telemarketer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy and quick. It would be hard not to receive job for this company. There is no dress code since it is a telemarketing job. Pretty laid back.
Interview Questions: Why work for Lion Line?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview experience was very positive. They asked straight forward questions, nothing out of the blue. They asked about course work and activities outside of school as well, so we talked about a range of topics.
Interview Questions: What extra curricular experience I had

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Hershey, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and nice facility. I have been almost a decade, but I can still recall the day I was there for the interview. They actually asked a lot questions, but all reasonable questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose Penn State

title: Telemarketer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not too difficult and basically anyone who attends Penn State and has a voice can get this position. This job is not very difficult but it takes a little time to adjust to the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Lion Line?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: email notice first and schedule the interview time, introduce yourself including your background and research and interests, then tell the reason why you chose this university and what you can bring for this university. It's quite like a normal interview, nothing special, just relax and be confident.
Interview Questions: Why you choose our university?

title: Restaurant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a multi level and professional interview with 3 senior leaders at the company.  This happened over the course of one day along with a personality assessment. They shared the results.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: AV Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the Nittany Lion Inn Part Time Hospitality Service Job Fair.  Met with a full time employee in the position and got the job offer after a couple interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Clinical Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: there was a one-day long interview process, with the entire department individually, plus group review of me actually teaching a class in the school (on the same day as the one on one interviews)
Interview Questions: what can we answer for you?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Talk with the professors about your interest of research areas.  Provide evidence of academic strengths in your field. Show your interest and confidence, also commitment to the job.  need to write more but not sure what to write about.
Interview Questions: What is your interest

title: Vr Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews after applying online, the interview was tailored to the coursework that I had completed and covered topics from those courses and increased in difficulty until I began making mistakes.  They were less interested with my skill set than they were with my problem solving process.
Interview Questions: How do you reverse an array?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Technical interview with lots of questions from your resume. Also, they will go through your academic performance and will ask relevant questions from your coursework. Finally, your performance in course project plays a key role.
Interview Questions: What are the course projects that you have done and how can it be further improved?

title: Residence Life Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: All day process.  Can be tiring but very similar to other institutional interviews for the same type of position.  You will have the opportunity to meet with various individuals within the department and departmental partnerships around campus.
Interview Questions: Question about diversity and inclusion

title: Cocurricular Programs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: After the application there were two rounds of interviews. The first was with a group of five people involved with or related to the job. The second interview was divided into two parts: one part with the same group from the first interview and the second with administrators.
Interview Questions: The first interview was a behavioral interview. The first part of the second interview was a follow up on answers from the first interview. The second part of the second interview was a more administrative, traditional interview. Focused on qualifications and fit for the position.

title: Undergraduate Researcher (ARL) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview and was encouraged to wear casual attire as the interview would take place during a tour of the lab. The person interviewing became my supervisor and project manager once hired, so first impressions were important. It seemed like it was very important to them that I be able to speak candidly and comfortably with them as peers and fellow researchers. They walked me around all parts of the lab that I would be working in to ensure that I was comfortable with the environment.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working on a project by yourself or with a small team of fellow undergraduates without direct supervision?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions:
I had a phone interview discussing the position and my qualifications. The interviewer concluded the phone screen by asking about salary requirements, which I freely shared. The interviewer then stated that the salary for the position would be in a certain (much lower) range. I was told i would receive a call back to confirm the salary range; several days have passed.

Penn State publishes job postings along with their salary bands. The range offered by the interviewer is in the lowest 25% of the band. Others have said this is typical Penn State behavior. They only offer in the lowest part of the range and never pay above the midpoint.
Interview Questions: What is your expected or target salary?

title: Marketing Strategy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn State (Penn State University, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview with 7 members. It was a little intimidating but I got a call for an in person interview the next day. I was asked to created a poster and give a presentation on my design process. I then met with the promotion staff and operations staff. Very positive experience.
Interview Questions: How do you respond to criticism?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Initial round was a skype interview about graduate research experience to gauge if the experience could fit in with the requirements of the lab. It went on for like 60 minutes and was about technical details of the research (very do-able).
Later called for visit to the campus to formally present my research experience to an audience consisting lab members and other faculty member. During the day, I met with other faculty member to know their research expertise, instruments that were available a comprehensive tour of various labs and lab related facilties on campus which was very impressive.
Interview Questions: Would I choose another position over this if the other offer was more impressive

title: Research Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (Hershey, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I got the interview with the Assistant professor of Neural and Behavioral Sciences at Penn State University (Hershey, PA) in September 2016. It was one face to face meeting with the Assistant Professor. I had to wait for the official offer from the HR department in about 1 month.
Interview Questions: The Professor was just basically explained what his laboratory research is doing and such. He asked a question about my experience in research, specifically in designing forward and reverse primers.

title: Network and Computer Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position online and was invited for an interview. I met with five people who asked a mix of technical and behavioral questions. The interviewers were friendly and had some small talk questions as well.
Interview Questions: Why would a server have two NICs?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Included a phone interview then in-person interviews at Penn State (with a little bit of money to help with the travel, but not fully covered). The in-person interview was 3 nights and 2 days, with the first day being casual, and the second day full of one-on-one or group-on-one interviews with faculty members. I left feeling like I only had a little time to really chat with my person of interest, but ultimately the in-person is not about assessing your skills and more about assessing your personality and your inter-personal fit with the community that's already there.
Interview Questions: Mostly they wanted to hear about research and what I want to study. Other times it was tough to get a word in because the faculty member would spend a lot of the (relatively little) time talking about her or his own research, so in those cases it was better to just ask an insightful question or end with a suggestion for future research.

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two supervisors who were on shift at the time. One of them specifically interviews all potential employees while the other just sat in on the interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe the proper way to perform a squat and perform

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Penn, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very quick process from application to interview.  I applied in April.  Received a request for a phone interview in early June and after the phone interview I was invited for face to face within a day.  The process was typical of faculty interviews.  You meet with the search committee as a group and they ask questions from a list. You make a research presentation and then give what they call a chalk talk.  It is an informal discussion about your teaching.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Penn State Harrisburg.  The questions were what you would expect from most university interviews.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 4 faculty at Hershey, and then 4 faculty at University Park. It was a very long two days with a lot of talking, siting through presentations, lab and campus tours, lunches and dinners. It'll be very exhausting, but nothing difficult. It is very laid-back and casual affair, they mostly just want to get to know you and your background and personality. You'll only have to interview at both locations if your particular program is in both campuses. If it's only available at University Park then you'll only have 4 interviews.
Interview Questions: They ask general education questions, research experience, publications, etc. Ask them about their research, tour their labs, and talk with their current students or post-docs. It was all very laid-back and the time goes by quickly. If the person your talking to isn't anti-social or awkward it can actually be very pleasant and fun.

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Participated in a twenty minute phone interview that went very well. At the end I was told someone would contact me to schedule an in-person interview, which someone did. About a week later I was called and told they were cancelling the interview because they had since filled the position. Who fills a position without first interviewing all the candidates?
Interview Questions: What is one strength and one weakness?

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Altoona, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is with the Classroom and Student Technology Manager.  The interview usually last 30-45 minutes.  It is very straight forward and is just the manager asking questions.  During the interview, the manager gives very little feed back and will not make it a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why would you be good at this job?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview was over two days. It involved meeting with current faculty members and instructional designers.  I gave a 50-minute presentation to a group of about 30 faculty members and graduate students concerning my research.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do outside of work?

title: Professional Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn State (Harrisburg, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a laid-back discussion about how I'd handle certain scenarios while tutoring. They just wanted to hear about my GPA and grades. What classes would I tutor if I was brought on.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the student is getting frustrated? How would you handle the situation?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: fairly informal, basically just sent out emails to interesting professors in the hope that they were doing research that I had interest in. If the professor got back to me, they basically said what they were researching, and asked for any experience that I had in this area. Even if the answer was very little, the interviewer looked for my interest in this area/ experience in similar areas.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with research?

title: Research Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I already knew a person I wanted to work for so I called him to set up the interview. They asked about my experience and described details of the position. Asked why they should hire me. There were a senior and mid-range manager. But it seems they tend to hire people they have already personally known.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a faculty member and I emailed the hiring department head. She scheduled me for an in person interview. I briefly interviewed with her. I was offered a position. I completed the proper paperwork and waited for a background check to be completed. I started about two weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with this software? Are you dependable? What's your feeling on working here?

title: .NET Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through dice. Initially i got a phone interview where i was 7 questions about mvc,stored procedures,rest api,caching etc.second round was F2F in PSU, there were 4 interviewers in conference room i was interviewed about 2 hours. first one and half hour it went well and last half an hour they have given me a user story to develop application i didn't do that application well.
Interview Questions: what is wcf,have you used it?

title: Human Resources-Employee Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted about a week after applying to participate in a phone interview.  The phone interview was a panel/group interview of 4 staff members.  They each took turns asking a question or two and then opened it up for questions from me.  The interview ended oddly, they just said thank you goodbye.
Not sure what the next step in the process will be, I am guessing if I move forward in the process there will be an onsite interview so no talks of an offer or not yet at this point.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have from your current role that relates to this role that you are interviewing for?

title: Innovation Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did this interview when I was a student. The position was a part time position at Krause Innovation Studio, which is a study/meeting space. Me and two interviewers were there. Both of them were students who were hired by the office. They asked me like ten questions. They were friendly.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you see a student in the study room who are violating our rule and eating food in the room? What if it was a professor?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: one on one interviews and then followed by a presentation and then more one on one interviews.  There was also a lunch and time to ask questions with the hiring professor at the end of the day.  Process was kept in three to four hour window.
Interview Questions: Where I wanted to go with research

title: IT Service Desk Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had to be a consultant first. Also had to be known and in good standing with supervisors to get an actual leg into the position. Once you are a consultant, they offer you the chance to apply for the position.
Interview Questions: What are my weaknesses

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a skype interview since I was an international student. We discussed my research experience, projects, coursework, educational background and research interests. We went into why I was particularly interested in this department and what career plans I had after graduation.
Interview Questions: Questions about current research experience, projects, coursework, educational background and research interests. Concluded with a little bit about my hobbies. One question that stood out for me was about how I dealt with stress to publish.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very nice and helpful people, easy to talk to. They made sure that I was comfortable, and went through the process fairly smoothly. A lot of behavioral questions, so be sure to know about past experiences you've had and how they will contribute to your time at Penn State. Also be sure to know about the history of PSU ( not just about football!) and why you would be a good fit for their environment.
Interview Questions: What have your past experiences done to prepare you for this position? Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Why do you think we should hire you over another candidate who wants this position?

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was very straight forward, my boss gave me 10 minutes to dismount a computer and put it back in to make it work at the end. This was an entry position for students so they don't expect you to be a super expert but to have basic knowledge of how everything works.
Interview Questions: What is the "Default Gateway" based on an IP address

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I found the process to be incredibly long from application to hire.  It was 5 weeks between application and phone interview; another 5 weeks between phone interview and in-person interview, and more than 4 weeks before I was offered the position.  It would be another 6 weeks before I was able to start my position, due to background checks and paperwork. This was the third time that I had applied to and been interviewed for a position within the department; I was expected a third rejection.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my research & analysis skills, my skill level at working with a variety of statistical programs, and my willingness to strengthen existing skills and develop new skills.

title: Director of Rugby Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a video chat interview which was then followed by an in person interview. The process was about 1.5 weeks long. Phone interview was with two coaches and in person interview was with 2 coaches and athletic director.
Interview Questions: What do you consider a high performance athletic program?

title: Lion Line Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn State in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There is a two step interview process.. The first interview is a phone interview where you do a mock call and ask an "alumni" for donations to the school and if you did well enough on that interview you were passed on to an in person interview. The in person interview was brief and very comfortable
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process in order to get a job as a graduate assistant. The process was just a resume and qualification review when you submit an application to the graduate school.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Research Technologists I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a really simple and fast process though it is probably PI specific. The main questions were just tell me about yourself then we went over my CV and previous experience and software knowledge.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with SPSS?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Penn State University, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was all good and easy. Asked a few simple questions like if I can connect to the pennstate network, or if I can format a mac or windows computer. Also, asked about my back ground in experience. The interview lasted just for about 30 mins. Thats all.
Interview Questions: What was your previous Job ?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I took this evaluation before I entered the university. The evaluation is a form that I have to fill in with my PhD application materials. The minimum requirement of TOEFL for international student is higher than 24 in oral part.
Interview Questions: your TOEFL score

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: That was easy. They asked me multiple questions about my prior experience with programming. They also asked about my interests to find the best fit within the team. Best experience ever.
Interview Questions: What is your major?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied and received a request for a phone interview the next day. Phone interview followed by an onsite interview and job offer coming one week later.  Very motivated to hire quickly. The interview panel was very friendly and didn't ask any questions that were out of the ordinary.  The onsite interview took approximately two hours and provided smaller meetings with an HR rep, direct supervisor, and a chance for the rest of the team members to ask questions. Very relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.
Interview Questions: Standard questions like "What are your strengths and weaknesses?" and "Why should we hire you for this position?"

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Typical 30 minute phone interview, not as many behavioral questions as I expected. Then they called back about a week later to schedule an in person interview. They had me meet with an excessive amount of people who all had different sets of questions. Half of the people definitely did not want to be in the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult customer

title: Lecturer In English Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Very brief.  The job itself was not described accurately, nor were the requirements (take classes weekly for an entire school year, have a mentor).  At the same time, the interviewer was honest about the low pay and the minimal chance for professional development or career advancement at Penn State.  Was not introduced to the actual individuals who would be assessing my progress and making all decisions regarding my work at PSU.
Interview Questions: What would you tell a student who asks why taking a composition and rhetoric course matters?

title: Lab Assistanr Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: email the lab manager or professor directly. If there is any open position in the lab, they will give you a chance to submit your cv or resume, unofficial transcript and etc. They will also give you a short interview to discuss the research projects.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work in xxx lab?

title: ITS Consult Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Round Up, IN) in Nov 2015
