Interview Descriptions: During interview, I was asked non-IT types of questions by a large group of current staff with limited PSU experience and work experience in general. It wasnt clear what the purpose was for those questions so was not sure how to respond. The questions were seemingly more appropriate for clerical office staff rather than professional IT applicants. (Eg. Describe one way you would improve your attendance or reduce the sick time used.  My response was to laugh because I thought the young girl was making a joke statement, which was not well received.) Questions were mostly shallow and  unsophisticated, with time wasted on illogical topics, and relative aspects offered were not of interest.  After 1 hour, the unfinished interview was ended by a director of the unit who stated suddenly "Thank you,  we will call you." and began telling others goodbye while I was still in my chair.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in registering for classes if you are hired?

title: Administrative Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: There were no "gotcha" questions. Interviewed with potential supervisor and various faculty and staff members. Later interviewed with just supervisor and had skills testing (basic Excel, writing an email). Met some staff members.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what sort of experience do you have working with faculty/students, how do you handle conflict, what workflows have you improved (time/efficiency), why do you want to leave current employer, experience working as a team?

title: Student Human Resource Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (Erie, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Offered an interview opportunity for supervisor position, sent in resume, offered instead to do scheduler interview, 1 interview with manager I would be working for, offered job the next day. Started training that fall while continuing as a student employee/supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work history.

title: Research and Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website.  Heard back after a few weeks and schedule a phone interview which lasted about an hour and asked the usual questions about my skills and interests.  They called back a couple weeks later to schedule an in-person interview.  At the time I was 9 months pregnant and due any minute, and they were super flexible with scheduling the interview.  I had the interview about a week after birth, and they broke up the day for me into 2-hour chunks so that I could go home and feed my baby in between interviews (I lived locally).  I thought it was very thoughtful of them.  The in-person interview was about 3-4 hours and had mostly the usual questions about my experience, skills, interests, examples of past projects, and some critical thinking "how would you approach this problem?" or "what would you do here?" type of questions.  Not too difficult but made you show your thinking skills.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would go about tackling this problem.  What are things you need to consider?

title: Cold Caller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Very standard interview. Ask a bunch of personality questions and want to make sure you're comfortable talking on the phone and have half decent communication skills. They will do a follow up interview that requires a mock phone call, nothing too difficult. Just want to make sure you can talk on the phone and aren't afraid of asking for money.
Interview Questions: Just make sure you prepare well for the mock phone call

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions:
They asked and checked some educational ethics especially about possible students cheating
You want to say you don't want to show your suspects to the students who you think are cheating
Interview Questions: What would you do if you found a student cheating in an exam

title: Banquet Server Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the position at the hiring hair they hold at the beginning of the semester. I wasn't sure what position I was seeking, and past restaurant experience lead me to be interviewed for the banquet department. The hiring manager was really nice, and understood that I was a full time student. Overall I think the hiring process was an easy one for a student, and have enjoyed it ever since.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work during game days"

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called for a phone interview about a week after applying. A week after the phone interview, I was called for an in-person interview. It took a month (4 weeks) after the in-person interview for me to receive the call that they were offering me the position.
Interview Questions: They asked questions about command line prompts.

title: Pizza Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Penn State University, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: apply online and they call you and set up interview in campus and in the interview they ask questions and then after days later they call you again if you got the job or not.
Interview Questions: who you are

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Go over math knowledge, tutoring skills, and communication skills. They just want to know how knowledgeable you are with certain math topics like basic algebra through Calculus II. Then they want to see how you would help someone solve a problem who is really struggling with the material. Also need to sit in on a few tutoring sessions.
Interview Questions:
Walk through the following calculus problem:

Find d/dx (1/x)

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted four hours and was conducted with four different groups of people and the director (who would be my supervisor). The first group was the developers I would be supervising. The second was a group of managers within the organization. The third were peer managers. The interview was easy. Everyone was friendly and it was a very comfortable experience.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a project go bad? If so, how did you back out of it?

title: Multimedia Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (Center Valley, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward and the employer explained exactly what the job entailed. Since I've worked with the employer on other assignments, the interview didn't take long. I was offered the position within the week.
Interview Questions: How will your past experience help you in this position

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Saw position posting online. Emailed Professor and was contacted next day to come in for an interview.  Interview was very relaxed one on one interview with professor about the position, what my responsibilities would be, and what my background was.
Interview Questions: General questions about my interest in the position and career and educational goals for the future.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit application and then wait several months; Initial phone or skype interview and then wait several months; get selected for onsite interview and then wait several months. it was with a group panel each time. They call and interview references for an extremely long time (up to 1 hour). be wary of job posts that are only up for 2 weeks, as this is the minimum they are required to post it, and that often means that they already have a candidate in mind to hire, but are posting it anyway just to fulfill the minimum requirements. All of that wasted time!
Interview Questions: How would you contribute?

title: Student Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first submit a resume through their and answered some basic "why do you want to work here?" open-ended questions on their website. Then over the summer break I received an email from a manager and we did the interview through Google Hangouts. Max 20min. interview, webcam and microphone required, look professional.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this position?

title: Undergrad Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Process was quick. Went in for an interview with PI and we talked about what my interests are and what my roles would be in the lab. PI contacted me the next day.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: Commons Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked about my class schedule, if i was willing to work overnights and how many hours I wanted a week. Did not really have an interview, just got a call from the office and they offered me a job after they received my application. Took over 5 months to hear back from them and they wanted me to start work as soon as possible. Let me pick my own schedule and where I was working.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal and laid back. Very pleasant and informative about all duties to be performed. Interviewer did ask a lot of questions about past experience. I was showed all the different areas that I would be working and equipment that I would be using. That was all before I was even offered the job.
Interview Questions: What hours I would be available.

title: Facilities Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview in front of a panel, followed by a written portion (essay-type questions). Panel consisted of people related to position being filled, as well as division head. Questions ranged from having you give general descriptions of experience to having you respond to situations with a proposed solution or procedure. Panel allowed for questions afterward. The whole process took a little over an hour.
Interview Questions: What is your budgeting experience?

title: IT Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Altoona, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. Submit a copy of your resume, then you will be contacted for interview. Everyone felt awful about the interview, and it is difficult. You will then be contacted and be offered a job, or you will never hear from them again.
Interview Questions: What is TCP/IP?

title: Student Desk Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was very informal, and easy. I did a call interview and it took less than 5 minutes. I was nervous because I thought I was not going to get the job but after the easy interview, I was almost for sure I got the job.
Interview Questions: what is customer service to you?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (Middletown, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a smooth process overall. The first stage was a phone interview as usual. It was a quite good experience. Friendly academic environment. Faculty and staff were very friendly and helpful throughout the process.
Interview Questions: What is your long-run goals?

title: Marketing Strategy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions:
Interviews progress in 3 stages: telephone interview, writing exercise, then in-person interview. First they called me to set up the telephone interview.

Phone interview: It was a round-table with the director of communications, numerous departmental employees, etc. sitting in a conference room on a speaker-phone, asking me questions.  They went around the room and read off a list of somewhat generic questions. They didn't respond or react to my answers in any way-- it sounded like they were just taking turns reading a question and then writing down my response. They also emphasized that Penn State is a large employer, and it can take some time to get things rolling, so I expected about a 2-month process.

Writing exercise: They must have liked me enough, because I progressed to stage 2-- the writing exercise. I spent a few hours developing a content strategy and sent that off to the recruiter and interviewer as instructed.
 
I was told the next step would be an in-person interview.
I never heard back from them again.  No rejection, no acceptance-- just silence. I followed up in a week and was told that they were still considering me. I followed up again about 2 months later and was told the same thing.

It's pretty discourteous of an employer to not even follow up with someone who took time out of their day and current job to interview with them.  I would reconsider working here as they do not treat perspective employees well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Good interview. Questions about goals and experience. Handling customers who may be angry. Overall was a good interview process and wasn't too stressful. Made comfortable and just was asked if dealing with customers was something I could handle and do on a daily basis.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with a difficult person before

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Slow. Application to offer date was almost 7 months. Two phone conversations with HR, One phone interview with Supervisor and Director, then an in person interview with a 5 person panel.
Interview Questions: General round table questions. "Tell me about a time when you succeeded in a project/didn't succeed in a project..."

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took a very long time to get an interview.  I was initially hired as a temporary worker and applied for the position when I saw it was posted.  I was about to take another position in a different organization when I finally received word that I was to be interviewed.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had an onsite interview.  Research presentation followed by one-on-one meetings with group members. The interview lasted approximately 5 hours.  Overall experience was great.  The interview process involved only a day.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my PhD Research

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the school website and then got an e-mail shortly after. The supervisor interviewed me and went over my resume. After that, we discussed my availability. Once that was done, I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: Are you a people person?

title: Development Representatives Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager interviewed me on the phone first, then scheduled an in-person interview. Nothing special. The one on one interview is just a show, there is nothing to worry about.
Interview Questions: Just to prepare to read the script and pretend you are calling.

title: Full Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to the campus. Spent the whole day doing interviews and a presentation. I had an intensive two-hour interview with the search committee, which turned out to be an enjoyable time to tell them who I am and learn about them. One of the best interview experiences of my life.
Interview Questions: Nope. All questions were asked with clear purposes of understanding me, my experiences, and what I can contribute to the college.

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I applied via mail, for this particular position they didn't want any digital applications. Two months passed before I was first contacted for an interview. I played phone tag with my interviewer for two weeks before we actually spoke and scheduled the interview for a Friday. It was the shortest interview of my life – so short that I didn't have to pay for my parking. I was still within the free first half hour. The following Monday they called me first thing to offer me the job.
Interview Questions: How do you practice diversity?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was 25 minutes phone interview. When they asked for cost to initiate my research, they insisted to know the exact number. Since it is a small college they were looking for someone that needs absolute minimum  cost to start his/her research. Let's say someone more into theories rather than exprimental
Interview Questions:
Q: Why are you interested in this position?
Q: Tell us more about your background?
Q: What kind of facilities you need to start you research?

title: Part Time Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: very informal conversation that took about 20 minutes. I went inside the room and was offered a beverage and told that this is just going to be a conversation and is not a formal interview. I was asked very basic questions and it was just the motivation that they were interested in.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? and Why you?

title: Greaduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penn State (Erie, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: We reviewed my skills and background. Very easy and straightforward questions about my personality and goals. She introduced me job details and deadlines. The she introduced me hiring process.
Interview Questions: 3.	What assignment was too difficult for you, and how did you resolve the issue?

title: Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very essy wuick talk about food service and good habdling of food nothing conplicated and really essy. Need to know how to operate ovens and kitchen stove it was a very essy interview overalll nothing out of this world
Interview Questions: How do you feel working with others

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I e-mailed to the professor I am interested in. Actually I was interested in his opening about two years ago. We did not make it because I got other opportunities. I am still interested in his work, and I connected with him again. He thought there is a great match between his opening and my background. So we even did not go through an interview. And I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Actually, there is not interview. He just describe all the work I am going to do in Penn State and he asked about the situation about me. He needs two recommendation letter from my previous supervisor. And we started working together for the visa transfer.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They will ask you to fill in the form and apply it with HR before you are screened for background check before they give you an interview and then you have to sign agreement before approved.
Interview Questions: your qualification and education history

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the PI. In my case, I had a phone interview first, and then had an on site interview. But the PI already made a decision beforehand. I met the people in the lab as a future coworker, and gave a presentation what I was working with.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Contacted a professor and get an phone interview, was asked to write a proposal about a specific research topic. Finished it in about a month and got an offer as research assistant.
Interview Questions: Questions about past research experiences

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The graduate program coordinator sent an email of this grader position, and it was available for the graduate students at our department, both master students and phd students. I submitted my resume and a cover letter to apply for this position. The interview questions were basically about past experiences and skill sets, and I got the job pretty easily because I knew the professor of the course, and he knew about my capability of the skills needed in this position. The whole process was efficient and pleasant.
Interview Questions: Why makes you a good fit for this position.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with professor who I contacted. Meeting was about 30 mins in length. Asked about previous technical and writing experiences. Some behavioral questions, mainly interested in learning your work ethic.
Interview Questions: What programming languages are you familiar with?

title: Service Desk Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional for a student position. I was asked mostly behavioral questions that tested my ability to handle common adverse situations between employees. Only a few technical questions were asked, which most low-level IT/engineering students could easily answer. I feel that most people with a positive attitude and commitment to great customer service can excel in this position. Responsibility is a primary focus of the supervisor position. Ensuring that all tickets are handled in a correct and efficient manner is perhaps the most important aspect of the job.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation in which you were involved in implementing a change that enhanced the workplace.

title: Undergraduate Enrollment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Had a phone interview two weeks after my initial application. Later had a presentation followed by a group interview and additional questioning. HR at PSU is extremely slow. The interview process is long and arduous. Penn State decided to withdraw the position. Three months were wasted. The department I interviewed with didn't even have the decency to call or email me to inform me that the position was withdrawn. Instead, I received a generic prompt from HR. I would say that was highly unprofessional considering how much communication I had with the department.
Interview Questions: Typical questions. Prepare beforehand and you'll do well.

title: Nutritionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took about a month, panel interview. The questions were difficult and one of the interviewers did not seem to like me. He kept asking the same question as if he was expecting a certain answer. I could not satisfy him, apparently. I got a letter about a month or two later stating that they had gone with another candidate. It was a stressful interview.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the foodservice department?

title: ITS Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website. The process was not very long. I submitted my professional resume and filled out all the info required such as s.s., date of birth, whether you are a U.S. citizen or not, etc. After applying, I waited for a couple weeks before being called by the manager to schedule an interview. Then, I set up a time for the interview. Be prepared by reading the required tasks you must do while being a lab consultant.
Interview Questions: What is customer service?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: minimal, asked about courses and other past experiences. The interview is not a formal process but depends more on the professor approached. It is a good idea to ask questions yourself about the position you are applying for as it is a 1 year commitment at the least.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview 3 1/2 weeks after I submitted my application (on line).  I was called 5 days later to interview in person.  I interviewed a week after that.  I was told that the hiring process is slow and checks take a while.  I was also told that after they said they wanted to have someone in place by the beginning of the month to mid month (2 weeks to a month after the interview).  I know they must be interviewing others, but I was not told either way.  I honestly have no idea what to think--whether I am seriously being considered still?
Interview Questions: I sat down and really thought about how my past experience connected with this job and prepared.  Lots of behavioral and situational questions in the in person interview.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The employee will ask previous questions of what have you done before, and ask what can you do to the present work. After that the employee will communicate some relax questions with you like talking about your family. The interview will be conducted on the line.
Interview Questions: How do you appreciate the present work in our field?

title: R&D Software Engineer II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screen, Skype, In person presentation and scenario session.  Very little technical questions, but they test more about my style of thinking and my communication skill. They were testing how well I can interact with students and faculty at a given time and if I were comfortable with presentations to a large group. I was definitely confident with that. I think the interview process was different than normal, I only had 3 days from time I got topic for presentation until my interview to prepare the material and present to the team.
Interview Questions: Can you use GPU acceleration for website image rendering

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Email contact first.
Phone interview next to discuss about my previous roles and research background and what will be the future project.
Asked some question related to my educational background and working experience. 
Team work and Time-management skills
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about the research projects you had been involved so far?

title: Student Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. I had to fill out documents and forms. Then i had to fill out my availability and what days i did and did not have class. Then, due to Penn States laws and standards, i had to get certified in two different areas. After that, i was hired.
Interview Questions: The only question that was asked was what days i was available.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the head of the department by email as well as by a detailed voice mail. The interview process was well planned an respectful of my time. I was given a tour of the campus, made a presentation to a class, conducted a rehearsal, was interviewed by the Dean and by the search committee over a delicious lunch, all in a few hours. All my interview expenses were reimbursed and I was accommodated overnight at a hotel in the area. I was introduced to most persons I ran into with the head of the department on campus. I was impressed with all the interactions I had.
Interview Questions: I was not asked any unexpected question. I felt that I was in a setting where people were trying to get to know me and I was being shown who they were.

title: Information Technology Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the process was laid-back. I had prior knowledge of the organization of the libraries, and also knew staff prior to be hired. So I can't say that my interview process was the same as others may experience. My advice for anybody with a regular interview is, though, to just be laid-back and friendly - it encompasses the library's culture. If you have the skill set to match the requirement, you'll likely be hired.
Interview Questions: How will your skills benefit our department?

title: Writing Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Reading, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: One on one with Holly. Very laid back, simple questions about what I was studying and my experience, the usual. Glad to have worked there, but I transfered to UP after a year
Interview Questions: Writing experience

title: Procurement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Plan reviews with up to six people. It was a round robin Q&A. The interviewers where from all levels of the department. The interview technic was situation, action, results. The questions were to understand how you reach to situations. Example; tell us about a time you had a difficult situation and what did you do and what was the result.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw something that was wrong what would you do and define what is wrong.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview that lasted roughly 45 minutes. Emailed resume. Received email a day later with the offer. Did not receive an actual offer letter until the start of the position
Interview Questions: What do I see myself doing in five years?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: This is department dependent. For most graduate programs you are accepted and then you attend a prospective weekend in which the department attempts to persuade you to attend. I found I was blatantly lied to during my prospective weekend. I was lied to about the student lifestyle, how the group dynamics work, and the work to life balance. I can not fully blame them though because if the truth would have been told no one would have attended.
Interview Questions: For my department you were expected to ask questions of the professors, read up on the professors whose group you want to join. Make sure you ask and attempt to find the truth out about the group's atmosphere and working environment.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a professor who had only been at the university for a few months, He seemed a bit disheveled and surprised that he had to do the interview.
Interview Questions: What what would you do if you were sick and had to teach?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
They emailed me and asked for CV. After couple of days, they gave me offer; easy process. 
They also asked me foe the English proficiency level
The HRs were very helpful and give me feedback in couple of months
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Support Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took a total of 6 months. Applied in March, got called for a phone interview in April, had an in-person 3-panel interview in May, received my official offer in July, and started in August. The hiring manager also had me complete an Excel spreadsheet as a "test". I was asked to create a staffing spreadsheet and show how I would organize the information. I made a pivot table and it was very well received. The panel laughed at me for wearing a business suit and said I wouldn't have to "dress like a lawyer" on the job.
Interview Questions: Why Penn State?

title: Engineering Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: You are interviewed in 3 sections. First by a panel of current employees, who ask pointless random questions and laugh at stuff. Then by the department head who digs a little deeper into your resume and you as a person. Finally there is a small get together with everyone in the department where the almost interrogate you and make uncomfortable situations for someone who inst a big people person.
Interview Questions: What were some projects I was proud of completing and why.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: It was a lateral Transfer in the department. I had no interview.
Interview Questions: I did not have an interview.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview with my boss where we talked about his expectations for a PhD student and what we both expected to get out of my time at Penn State if I came to work for him.
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty much as expected. Mostly they were about what I expected the PhD experience to be like and what I thought I was going to get out of it.

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Penn State is serious when they hire new staff. They plan the interview time and date and send a parking pass for your convenience. The interview team usually consists of 5 or more people.
Interview Questions: There are many questions - the most difficult are the situational questions. How would you handle....; tell us about a time when... How have you resolved .....?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: First emailed the professor for a possible postdoc position, then prof. emailed back and sent some papers related to the project, and then scheduled a Skype interview. Then made the offer in 2 weeks. Interview lasted about 30 mins, and he asked me about my PhD research mostly, and also asked what I have published so far. He also asked my role in some of the other papers that I was coauthor, so..
Interview Questions: Details about specific project: What do I know about the experimental part of the project?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was notified about the interview via phone call after about 3 weeks after applying, pretty quick in my opinion. I was told to dress "business casual." The interview itself was panel style with a variety of managers and a HR person. They asked some typical questions, but a couple of curve balls as well. But, it wasn't a negative experience. It was actually a nice opportunity to get a feel for the culture and my potential co-workers attitudes. After about a week I was notified that I had secured the position.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you did something nice for someone without being asked?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral question asked during the interview for admission. I think my previous experience of teaching and ability to work on diverse things at the same time did help. Also, it was important to maintain my GPA, if not I would have lost assistantship
Interview Questions: Nothing out of box

title: Systems Administrator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is extremely long.  I applied for a position with an immediate start and was not called for an interview until over two months later.  I interviewed in front of a panel.  I was asked many questions, some of which did not pertain to the position (were about me and my life).
Interview Questions: I was asked if I was prepared to be in this position for the long haul.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submit the school application and then wait for a couple month. Then I heard back from one professor scheduling a skype conversation with me. During the skype talk, we discussed about my research interests.
Interview Questions: What research area interests you the most?

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview is held for my application of PhD process. A professor give me a phone interview. In the phone interview, he asked me several questions. I.E. what is the algorithm you are using in your master thesis. Do you have programming experience in ROS system.
Interview Questions: Do you know ROS system.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Discussed research interest with potential advisors after emailing all of them to let them know I was looking for a graduate research assistant. The interview process included both personality questions and technical questions. The technical questions were oriented at figuring out if previous experiences were a good match with the advisor's research expectations.
Interview Questions:
Q: Coding questions
Q: Past experiences
Q: Reserch interests

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just a few basic questions about computer hardware and software.  Then a few hastily interview type questions that don't really have much of a purpose.  Easy Interview, I think they were ready to hire anyone really
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Apply and wait for acceptance, there are no interviews. They consider grades and research experience
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Strategy Specialist for the School of Agricultural Sciences Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my cover letter and resume on the PSU job website. I got called two weeks later and set up an interview for the next week. They were able to hold a Skype interview... which was great considering I live 3+ hours away. The interview was with 3 people and lasted about 45 minutes. They didn't delve into anything personal. It wasn't that challenging, but it was only the first round. Three weeks later, they sent out an email saying they were no longer going to fill the position. Blah.
Interview Questions: First they described the duties of the role (thankfully I took notes). Then, they asked my what part of it I would do best. Then they asked which part I would struggle with the most.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after letting me know that I was shortlisted they invited me for an interview. I gave a one hour talk and then in the following two days discussed with the faculty members of the group having long discussions about future and past work. Irrespective of the application results, the discussions were very fruitful. Got new ideas to work on!
Interview Questions: What are future research projects?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was formal, but not very stressful. I met with three staff members. They mostly asked behavioral questions, such as describe your weakness, what will you do when you disagree with your boss, etc.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you initiated something and followed through

title: Academic Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Internal interview as I was already employed at the university.
Interview Questions: They gave examples of case studies and asked how I would handle the situation.

title: Rather Not Say/University Park Campus, Non Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview seemed to go well, prepared presentation for panel interview which seemed to go well, I sensed I was well liked during the entire process. Was told it could take 4 weeks before I would hear one way or another.  Just checked after 5 weeks and web site said job status was "withdrawn" which means the job posting will not be filled at this time.
Interview Questions: "Have you ever..." asking me if I had performed a task/had experience in something that quite obviously I did not have and they would have realized this prior to the in person interview.  Was wondering why this wasn't asked during the phone screen --if that particular experience was so crucial to getting the job we could all have been spared a lot of time and effort when I said I did not have it over the phone.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: A very pleasant experience chatting with the professor hiring and one of the senior research program associates. Because of the dispersed, global nature of academia we conducted the interview over Skype. I was on holiday in a remote part of South America at the time and the interviewers were very accommodating with the intermittent difficulties of the satellite internet connection.
Interview Questions: As is typical for Postdoc interviews I was asked to provide a summary of my research.

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Rather easy, managers are very experienced and are looking more for attitude than experience. Barely any of the standard "Interview Questions" just asking about slightly personal questions about your past behavior in the workplace. This was an entry level tech support position, and they have training for the students who are hired.
Interview Questions: How would you handle someone coming late to work multiple times?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State (Media, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: First we had a phone interview, there was a group at the other end. Then they asked me to visit. More questions from the panel. Then I was asked to go back for a second visit because they couldn't decide between me and one other person. If you are currently employed and want to be considered for the job, they will insist on calling your current supervisor. They will tell him/her who they are and that you have applied for a job with them, and ask about your personality and work ethic.
Interview Questions: Give us the contact info for your current supervisor.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I approached the professor after attending one of the seminars. We talked for a while and she asked me to mail her. After mailing her I waited for almost 2 months to hear back from her. Had an interview with her on-campus and got hired.
Interview Questions: Basically general questions regarding my goals, plans for future, work interest, work ethics and so on.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn State (Altoona, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted CV in response to an advertised position. Fast response, quickly schedule interview and offer made withing in a week of interview.
Interview Questions: Whay are you interested in the position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. The selection was on basis of merit, GRE, and TOEFL scores, recommendation letters, and statement of purpose. The whole process took about three months and the decision was informed via email.
Interview Questions: There was no interview. The selection was on basis of merit, GRE, and TOEFL scores, recommendation letters, and statement of purpose.

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is not really a interview process. They accept your resume and the online form for the job and select you if they like your qualifications etc.If you have a recommendation from a professor that he/she'd like you to be her LA/Grader then you pretty much just need to apply and everything else will get taken care off.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Some faculty talked to me over skype they asked me several questions about my advisor university career goals and they said they will inform me later.
Interview Questions: What is your area of research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview. Asked questions about experience, expertise, work-ethic. Very standard interview
Interview Questions: How often do you work at work

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Skype Interview over the phone with three people. Very relaxed discussion and smooth process.
Gave me proper time to think over questions. Explained the background of the project comprehensively. Over all nice experience
Interview Questions: Why I am interested in the position? Some technical questions related with work. Salary expectation

title: Lecturer-fixed Term Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Harrisburg, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: The hiring manager requests recruitment to a new or vacant position
Step 2: HR completes all detailed information
Step 3: The delegated authority approves the requisition
Step 4: HR coordinates advertising of the position
Step 5: The Selection Committee is convened
Step 6: The Selection Committee shortlists applicants for interview
Step 7: The Selection Committee interviews candidates
Step 8: The Selection Committee conducts reference checks
Step 9: The Selection Committee chair advises all candidates of the outcome of the interview
Step 10: The Selection Committee chair notifies HR of the successful candidate
Step 11: HR issues the formal offer of employment
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel  interview with three individuals. A supervisor and two managers. Questions were ask about your IT experience, knowledge, and interest. Interview was on-site and lasted about 30-45 minutes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: No "standard" interviews. Went directly to professor, talked about research and filled out paperwork to become an RA in the lab the same week. Had to complete a background check, which was completed in approximately one week
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to this research project?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my potential advisor (one of the top people in my subfield) after I applied and he replied within eight minutes!  We spoke twice on Skype and he was very interested and supportive of my plans.  Later that month, I sneaked out on my lunch break and talked to the department chair and other faculty members, who were also very interested in my research and teaching plans.  Later that week, I got an offer with a 15,000/year assistant-ship and $750 entrance scholarship.  Several days later, I received confirmation that I would have a federal grant worth $20,000/year with $2,000 in conference travel, 1,000 in book allowance, and $600 in book allowance.  Later that year, my advisor offered me $2,500 in summer teaching.  Therefore, my total compensation is the same as when I was teaching prekindergarten in the South: 42,500.
Interview Questions: What my research interests were?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: Application to the graduate school first, send CV, TOEFL, GRE score to the physics department. No need to send the official copies at the first time, they will require that after you got accepted. I even did not need to pay the application fee before I got accepted.
Interview Questions: Actually, no interview for international students

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Media, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: We did group activities and puzzles to show who could take the lead the most and come up with ideas that would help the group succeed. I think they look for people who aren't afraid of setting up and taking control, especially since that's what the job consists of most of the time.
Interview Questions: How would you solve this problem?

title: ITS Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is fairly basic for Lab Consultants. Submit your resume online through Penn State ITS Lab Consulting website. They hire at the beginning of every semester for employees for the next semester. If they are interested in more information, they contact you for an interview. After that initial interview, they let you know if you got the job.
Interview Questions:
Previous work experience?
Past ITS/customer service experience?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Graduate student interviews vary depending on the department.  Most interviews will be a basic conversation with a few faculty members and possibly visiting with some current graduate students.  Some departments have fun, exciting people while others have faculty that are simply using graduate students to fulfill their current research projects.
Interview Questions: What faculty member do you want to work with?  In many departments, you must have an academic adviser picked out prior to being accepted.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn State
Interview Descriptions: The hiring was done on the basis of our performance in the 1st semester of our MS degree in Electrical Engineering and the previous scores.
Interview Questions: There was no interview for this job, this job was solely based on out performance in our Master's degree.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (Shenango, PA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Group telephone interview and group in-person interview. Intimidating atmosphere; several "gotcha questions" regarding Drupal. Some individuals on the interview panel were obviously texting each other about my answers during the interview. Who does that?
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself in terms of education and professional experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Arrive at the Nittany Lion Inn on day one. Have dinner with some grad students and professors. Next day full of interviews with prospective faculty. Then enjoy a night out with grad students.
Interview Questions: What kind of research are you interested in?

title: Facilities Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long periods of little communication through the process.  Multiple interviews done by committee.  Speed of getting through the process does not seem to be a concern.  Makes you wonder how many candidates are lost due to lack of communications
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were typical interview questions.  Nothing was out of the ordinary.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication led to an in-person interview where I signed documents. They conducted a background check, and when I was approved I was asked what times would be convenient for me to come in to shadow a current work study student.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions, I was just asked for the basics like current semester standing and how many hours I'd be willing to work per week.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Positive, friendly, open, easy.  This is a relationship-focused small-circle department-based employer.  The world "collegial" really means something here.  It's important though to bring something to the table they haven't heard before.
Interview Questions: demeanor, acumen based, followed by teaching demo

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the college staff, director and dean after being referred by a current development officer.  I visited with upper management of the division prior to applying or and interviewing for a position.  Applied in the past without much success.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: The application was all online. After a few weeks, contact was made through email to schedule a single interview. The interview was 1 hour long and focused on the tasks of the position. There was time at the end to ask any questions about the position.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in working with?

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It's a long process.  I interviewed with ten people.  I also had a group interview and because it was hard to get people together on the same day, there were weeks between interviews.
Interview Questions: How would I change the department?  This was on my first interview and it was not a management job.  It turned out that the director had a huge ego and he didn't want people coming in and changing his department.  I felt like I was a bug under a microscope.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Penn State (Abington, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I received an e-mail from the chair of my department (not Penn State) that Penn State was looking for someone to teach my course.  I sent my resume to the dean.  She called me immediately, I came in the next day and was hired for the next semester.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: HUB Information Desk Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview. You go in and pretty much tell them your schedule you are looking for. Their is not much to the interview its just a first come first serve process. It's only their to see if you will come in.
Interview Questions: Can you work by yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: normal application for graduate school. Getting funding is based on the availability of positions and matching interests with specific faculty members. Professors do a good job of advertising the positions.
Interview Questions: Statement of purpose, present research ideas and plans.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn State (Harrisburg, PA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Department Chair.  Very relaxed atmosphere, collegial.  Able to meet with other faculty and administrators who were friendly and engaging.  This was for an adjunct position, so much less rigorous than a tenure-track interview
Interview Questions: Describe your teaching experience

title: Administrative Support Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews of 1 hour in length. Panel of 4 interviewers took turns to ask about various aspects of the jobs I have handled. Each member of the panel had a copy of my resume. The more work anecdotes of various experiences you can share eloquently gets you the job. Mostly behavioral questions. Ability to learn new software is critical
Interview Questions: Who was your worst boss and why?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the professor who wanted to hire me, paper work got done in a day. Started getting paid within a week. Also It was helpful to attend the seminars and presentations of the professor prior to the interview. Maybe even take his/her course
Interview Questions: Are you interested in "?" research problem. What do you understand by this topic etc

title: Wait Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. I applied online through Penn State job listings. I received a call to come in and meet with the Restaurant manager for a very short interview. The interview was very conversational. My interviewer made me feel very comfortable through out the whole process.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about my availability mainly.

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. After reviewing my application materials, I was invited to interview with the Director and two other administrative faculty. The interview felt friendly and supportive. They didn't ask any difficulty or left-field questions. Th interviewers were knowledgeable and helpful.
Interview Questions: What kinds of courses are you capable of teaching.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the Professor and some discussion on our research focus and potential research opportunities.
Interview Questions: Asked about what type of tools to use for reverse engineering

title: Residential Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn State (Altoona, PA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview is with 3 to 5 people. I can't seem very intense. Answer the questions directly don't tell a story they don't wont that. Most all of the question are customer service and technology based.
Interview Questions: What operating systems do you have experience with?

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Resume screening, walk in interview
Interview Questions: recite the alma mater

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with several members of the team as well as with the department dean, who was a bit distracted. Overall, I think I was too old to be considered.
Interview Questions: Mostly chit chat

title: PhD Student, Counselor Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Full day interview with entire faculty (dyadic format with other grad. students), very organized and accommodating, offered to reimburse after interviews were over. Faculty were supportive and aware of labor intensive interview process. Provided free lunch and tour of campus, as well as organized dinner with current students to debrief. Current PhD Students are involved in interview process and are evaluating candidates as well.
Interview Questions: Why Penn State?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The application process to the graduate program was straightforward and standard for the industry. I was invited for the interview "weekend" (Thursday night through Saturday afternoon) and this is where I realized I was a poor fit for the institution. Although they regard themselves as one of the best programs in the industry, they had no rationale beyond citing themselves. Yes, they have one of the top researchers in our field, but even she did not seem enthused about the program. Choosing a graduate program is about "fit" and we were not a good one. Between interviews, all of the candidates were in one medium-sized room and facilitators circled around us to make sure we were "networking." As an introvert, all of that togetherness made me very anxious and I felt overwhelmed.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are better than the other applicants invited this weekend?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a three step interview process. I am an international student, so the were all telephonic interviews. Three different professors interviewed me, there were few technical questions in first two interview. Third interview was pretty much trying to convince me that it is a good school and why I should join them.
Interview Questions: some technical  questions about troubleshooting PCR. Rest were just chit chat, perhaps they were testing my communication skills.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Erie, PA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I emailed to ask for the opportunity to get a job lifeguarding at the pool and received an email back that I would be hired. I had to be certified in CPR and required to maintain pool safety at all times. It was a great job.
Interview Questions: When have you been in a leadership position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Professors are trying to hire graduate students for research purposes.  They are asking very technical questions related to your educational background.  Also they often consider students' previous course grades.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Resume review followed by phone screen conducted by two administrators.  Next step was a full day of interviews with various stakeholders.  At some point during the interview day, it was required to lead a presentation on a topic of my choice (I chose to speak about future strategic initiatives), which was attended by most of the interviewers and invited faculty and staff.
Interview Questions: What did I think could be done in the first 6 months of employment?

title: Housing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Erie, PA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was called for a phone interview several months after applying for this position. I was invited to campus for an interview a few weeks later. Lodging accommodations were lovely, but the hotel was a significant distance from campus which was inconvenient (dare I say inconsiderate) for an 8 a.m. start time and this also automatically made me curious if not apprehensive about the immediate area. 

Throughout the day, various interviewers asked me several times if I noticed any "red flags" about the position/institution.

Still, after a thorough and very comfortable interview/introduction process with a bevy of department employees and associates I was quite optimistic about the possibility of working at the Behrend campus. However, my excitement was short lived due to 1. a slightly awkward campus tour that did finally lift some of those asked-about red flags and 2. the 20-minute wrap up with the supervisor for this position. After a very long (and cold) day, I had the last-minute, very unexpected surprise that the live-off housing position I was applying for would pay at least $15,000 less than the live-on position I currently held.

But wait, it gets better. ... I did not let on that I was surprised and discouraged by the salary disclosure and I was told that my references would be checked the following week and I should expect the background check process to begin soon. I was one of three total candidates who were invited to campus. Well, none of my references were checked nor was the background check initiated. The week after my interview, news of the Penn State sex abuse scandal broke and I respectfully decided not to call and bother anyone with petty questions about my candidacy during such a difficult time for the university. 

Unfortunately, the way I learned I would not be offered a position was not by letter (or more appropriately at this stage, a phone call) from the position's supervisor or human resources associate. No, more than a month following my interview, a public repost of the position was my first clue that I was no longer being considered for it. Out of sheer curiosity, I had to call and was told the department still needed to find the "best fit" (personality) to fill the position. That's right. After what seemed like a very lengthy and bureaucratic process, the selection committee was not satisfied by ANY of the final three candidates they brought to campus for an EXEMPT ADMINISTATIVE position that pays less than what I earned waiting tables in college.

I consider it a blessing that I did not have to learn the hard way that the personalities in this very proud department are so picky and presumably hard to please.
Interview Questions: Have there been any red flags about working here so far?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is straightforward. Send your resume to the concerned professor who works in your area of interest. If the professor does not respond, send him a reminded after few days. If that does not work, go to his office personally and ask for an appointment. Once he gives an appointment,describe your interest enthusiastically.
Interview Questions: what is that you want to work on?

title: Teacher's Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Penn State (Reading, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: If you perform well in class, you may be asked to join the teacher's assistant program. You will then undergo a semester long class discussing the pertinent issues involved in aiding in the classroom. As long as your grades do not decrease and their are no major issues with your work ethic you will be a teacher's assistant until graduation.
Interview Questions: Dealing with students who are smart, but have no work ethic or motivation.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the professor. Since I was a graduate student at Penn State, I was quite familiar with the adviser. After the check of my background, including my transcripts, publications and achievements, the professor was satisfied. During the interview, I introduced my personality and convinced the professor that I am a good researcher.
Interview Questions: Are you a good team worker

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: First you have to apply for the graduate program in Material Science and engineering. The requirement can be found from their website. Once you decide the research direction, you need to start contacting with the professor working in the similar research area.
Interview Questions: Basic knowledge of material science

title: Dorm Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (Monaca, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Head of IT on the campus saw I was going for an IST degree and emailed me asking if I would interview for the dorm technician job. I said yes and the interview was set up on my first day at the campus and was easy enough. Just a simple check I know a computer inside and out and how to troubleshoot common issues students may face.
Interview Questions: Opened a tower for a desktop computer and took it apart asking me what each part is and then to put it back together again.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had to request an interview with the specific professor I wanted as an advisor. There wasn't any formal interview process, but I was expressing interest in the program, and they seemed to appreciate my willingness to come talk about possible opportunities. We mostly discussed my class and research background and how I might fit into the research projects ongoing at the lab.
Interview Questions: Describe my role in previous research.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is extremely long and tiresome. You have a presentation, followed by a meeting with a panel, followed by one-on-ones with sometimes multiple people. You should expect to be there for 3 to 3 and half hours for the entire process. In addition, Penn State takes their time to get back to candidates leaving you questioning if you have gotten the job - I would not expect a quick turn around. The interview questions were not difficult, pretty straight forward and tailored to your experience.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions - tailored to job

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Penn State (State College, PA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process starts with applying for a position through the jobs site. Resumes and cover letters are uploaded to the site and associated with an open position. Resumes and cover letters are reviewed by the department hiring, usually the manager/director and a few select employees on the hiring committee. If an employee does not live in the area, initial interviews are done over the phone. Second and third interviews are often done face to face. Usually interviews have 3-5 people asking questions. After a candidate is chosen, HR will be notified of the choice. HR determines a salary based on the experience and education of the candidate. An offer is sent to the candidate for them to accept or refuse. If they refuse, the process is repeated on the next candidate.
Interview Questions: Explain Kerberos

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long. You go through a phone interview and face to face interview; however, it takes many weeks/months for this process to be completed. Even when the the interview process is over, it takes a very long time for HR to provide you an offer and it is very difficult to negotiate. Usually they have a "take it or leave it" attitude.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had to deal with conflict at work.
Tell me about a time when you made a positive impact in the workplace.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn State (University Park, PA) in Feb 2011
